job_title: Home Health & Hospice in Doylestown, PA
pros: Hard workers, skilled and caring clinicians that want the best for their patients and system they work for.
cons: Limited training processes that lead to punitive environment when unable to perform to unclear standards resulting in quick turn over, loosing qualified staff.  Micromanagement that encourages poor communication.  Often ask employees to take on multiple job descriptions with fear of not being a "team player" when they are unable to fill the roles due to lack of applicants and quick turn over.  Employees not able to be used to their full potential, not allowing for efficient change, resulting in burnout.  No support for certification or education opportunities to support patient care practices. Do not support work life balance.

review_title: I developed lasting relationships with coworkers and was able to develop key life skills (ie communication).
pros: I was lead by a wonderful management team; they were quick to teach and allowed for fun on the job while still keeping a professional environment. I worked my way from a server to a hostess and it was a great, rewarding experience to achieve this accomplishment for myself.
cons: Residents can definitely cause stressful situations, and if not knowledgable in resolving conflicts it can make the job a lot harder.  There was also a lot of gossip among the staff about residents and each other which could make the working environment uncomfortable.

pros: It's not a good place to work

What a shame ...The other problem there is : -If you are manager or director nobody touch you...You are staying in your position the rest of your life....
